intro: Sanguisorba maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan bloodwort, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its striking red-tinged leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a distinctive reddish coloration, especially when exposed to sunlight. Sanguisorba maroccana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
